intro: Galium erectum f. falcatum, commonly known as the cat's-tail bedstraw, is a flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender, ascending stems and opposite, lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense, cylindrical clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. Its leaves and stems are often used in traditional herbal remedies for their purported medicinal properties.
